fields.title: About
fields.content:
In June of 2006, our founder, Clint Savage founded the Utah Open Source Foundation. An organization loosely based upon a previously defunct organization called the Utah Open Source Coalition.

The Utah Open Source Foundation quickly moved forward and in December of 2006, a small committee had been formed and it was determined a conference about open source in Utah was a strong way to grow open source in Utah.

The charter of the Utah Open Source Foundation (UTOS) is to help open source grow in Utah. To do this, it was decided to help the Local User Group (LUG) communities. Developers and others generally participate in a LUG and can benefit more directly through a LUG.

fields.title: Home
fields.content:
Utah Open Source Conference 2008

This Year's Theme: HOWTO...

The idea is that within the technology, education, community and business tracks, there will be plenty to talk about.

  • HOWTOs will help others get started
  • HOWTOs will help families use open source together
  • HOWTOs will provide a stepping stone along the road to technology mastery
  • HOWTOs will let those that are masters get together and make the products better.

There are many more things that the theme HOWTO will accomplish during the Utah Open Source Conference (UTOSC) 2008.

Because 2007 was such a grand success, we've made some minor changes and improvements to help with a smoother conference. This year's conference has moved location and added a full day on Thursday.

The Utah Open Source Conference 2008 will be held at the Salt Lake Community College, Redwood Road campus from August 28 - 30, 2008.

The Salt Lake Community College Computer Science department is excited to be a sponsor of the 2008 conference and will be using it to improve students' awareness and understanding of open source software.

The Utah Open Source Foundation is also rededicating itself to ensure the pricing structure remains reasonable for those who'd like to come and are on a budget. The pricing structure right now is tentative, but no major increases in the fees are planned for attendees.We currently have a tentative plan on our wiki, feel free to have a look. If you have suggestions, please feel free to join the chat at #utos on irc.freenode.net or email clints at utos dot org with your comments.

See you all in August.

Clint Savage
Founder, Utah Open Source Foundation

fields.title: REGISTER
fields.content:
Information & Registration

To register for UTOSC 2008, there are several options. Please keep in mind early registration ends on June 2, 2008. Register now and SAVE up to $30. For more info, view pricing below.

Register Online

Registration will open on or around June 2, 2008

Register By Mail/Fax

To register by mail, please complete the registration form (PDF) and mail to:

Utah Open Source
Attn: UTOSC 2008 Registration
PO Box 103
Springville, Utah 84663

Media Registration

Requests from Media should be forwarded by email to staff@utos.org.

UTOSC 2008 Pricing

UTOS has always tried to keep the costs low for those in the community. UTOSC 2008 will be no different. Here is the breakdown for UTOSC 2008.

Attendee TypeEarlyRegular
SLCC CS Student
Must provide student ID and discount code		$0$20
Local User Group Member
Discount codes can be obtained from any LUG Leader		$35$50
General Admission$70$100

What’s Included?

Access to these and more:
  • 40+ sessions (Thu – Sat)
  • All keynote presentations
  • On-site networking events
  • ~6 keynote presentations
  • BoF Sessions
  • Lightning Talks
  • Vendor and Non-Profit Expo Hall
  • Saturday -=- Family Day
